comments.message:
Patch Set 1:

Rendered versions are available at: https://us-east.manta.joyent.com/rmustacc/public/webrevs/OS-5910/index.html

Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

There is this one trailing space, other than it, LGTM.

Patch Set 3:

Please update the copyright statements in the various Makefiles.
Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.
Uploaded patch set 8: Commit message was updated.
Change has been successfully merged by Robert Mustacchi

What's `.No` doing here?
Shouldn't you use .Sq for the things, too?
I had missed .Sq, I should use that.
usbskel certainly seems to use "configuration cloud".  Does anything else?  What a silly name
I can't find much with public docs, only really in the source.
Probably should. Really, I need to make mandoc render the Dv like the Sy as we did in the older way we generally typeset things in roff.
usb_ep_descr and usb_xep_descr are missing descriptions.

Presumably you meant to change this to prefix_ too?
I think traditionally we've used xxx_foo() as dummy names.
Apparently the multi word argument should be included in double quotes, or you get type and name comma separated.
I don't like "DMA memory", but can't think of good alternatives
I took a stab at this in all of the transfer manuals.
"If memory is not available" (I worry you may have done this elsewhere too, and I missed it)
teardown of a pipe or... what?  I imagine the "or" is superfluous, but maybe I missed something big, and another noun should be there?
Do something with this.  Is this the same 9T I wanted?  If so, just use (9), like you convinced me to.
It turns out that I was going to put some of that in usba_hcdi, but I don't really have a bunch of stuff there for now as I'm not 100% sure on all of that yet.
Think the comma is not needed here.
"Because the root hub is a virtual hub, the HCD driver is responsible for making it appear to the system as a normal USB hub" ... or something, maybe?

There's a mdoc macro for that.  Probably cite it as a publication?
(.RS/RE)
Do you want the citations inline or in the See Also?
Do you want the citations inline or in the See Also.
This (and the other 9S) pages leave me wondering if there aren't better ways to format these.  Maybe ask Yuri?

What kind of formatting are you looking for? This is what I ended up doing for the GLDv3 stuff based on how we traditionally do structure members. I agree it's not great, but I dunno if I have better suggestions.

Is there a specific aspect you dislike or think could be better?
